meanings.definition: The practice of feeding on only one type of food.
meanings.sent1: Her monophagy for carrots made her the go-to expert on carrot recipes.
meanings.sent2: The bear's monophagy for fish led it to the same fishing spot every day.
meanings.sent3: His monophagy for pizza was so extreme that he only ordered pizza for every meal.
meanings.sent4: The bird's monophagy for seeds symbolized its unwavering dedication to a healthy diet.
meanings.sent5: The monophagy of the koala for eucalyptus leaves is a well-known fact among wildlife enthusiasts.

meanings.definition: An organism that feeds exclusively on a single type of food.
meanings.sent1: The panda is a classic example of a monophagy, as it mainly eats bamboo.
meanings.sent2: The hummingbird is a monophagy that primarily feeds on nectar from flowers.
meanings.sent3: The monophagy of the koala for eucalyptus leaves is a well-known fact among wildlife enthusiasts.
meanings.sent4: The butterfly's monophagy for milkweed showcases its specialized diet.
meanings.sent5: The monophagy of the koala for eucalyptus leaves is a well-known fact among wildlife enthusiasts.
